Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. DJ is not clipped, now in loose protective plastic overwrap. Prelims + 207pp including index with 26 illustrations. Ralph Verney, born in 1879 was godson to Florence Nightingale. In 1900 he was sent to South Africa where the Boer War was in progress. He wrote regularly to his parents, decribing every detail of his daily life. Fortunatley these letters have survived and been edited for publication by Ralph's own son. (IH-NNY-EYY-WaBy).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First. 207 pages, illustrated, family tree, indexed. Very nice clean copy in like protected dustjacket. * Verney (born 1879) joined the Rifle Brigade and fought in the South AFrican Boer War. Many letters relate to his daily life as a soldier there. In 1907 he became ADC to Lord Chelmsford, then Governor of Queensland, two years later marrying Nita Walker,daughter of distinguished Australian banker and politician. On the eruption of the First World War he fought with his old regiment on the Western Front. He was wounded; he later returned to India rejoining Lord Chelmsford.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 26 b/w Photographs (illustrator). 1st. 207 clean, unmarked pages; letters of this young British officer ( 1879 to 1959), from 1900 to 1916. He served with the 2nd Battalion THE RIFLE BRIGADE, and saw service in the BOER War, in India, and In France during the Great War 1914 to 1916; First Edition, First Printing.
